summary:
an aesthetic board for my fic witch queen 

In a twist of fate, the old gods choose Sansa instead of Bran. Now Sansa must cope...
caption:
an aesthetic board for my fic witch queen

In a twist of fate, the old gods choose Sansa instead of Bran. Now Sansa must cope with visions of the past and dreams of the future, with knowledge that could destroy or save her family. Now Sansa must find a way to escape her gilded cage and seek the dragons-for only dragon fire can destroy the threat lurking beyond the wall.

summary:
Sansa Week- Free Choice
Sansa sat up. “Lady,” she whispered. For a moment it was as if the direwolf was there in the room,...
body:
Sansa Week- Free Choice

Sansa sat up. “Lady,” she whispered. For a moment it was as if the direwolf was there in the room, looking at her with those golden eyes, sad and knowing. She had been dreaming, she realized. Lady was with her, and they were running together, and… and… trying to remember was like trying to catch the rain with her fingers. The dream faded, and Lady was dead again.

@sansasource

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

tags: day 1: Sansa's POV or Jon's POV
title: FIRST KISS
body:
Written for @jonsansasource’s JonSansaWeek Day 1: Sansa’s POV or Jon’S POV

This little snippet has no setting and no certain universe. It’s just their very first kiss, first described through Sansa’s eyes and then through Jon’s.

Sansa’s POV

Sansa had read a thousand books about this moment, but somehow she was not sure if any of those books had really managed to capture how it truly felt. She felt a certain kind of pleasant nervousness in her stomach. Her skin tingled wherever his hands and body touched her and her heart was beating rapidly in her chest with longing excitement.

“Are you sure you want this?” Jon spoke softly and Sansa let out a deep breath, cursing because he dared to make her wait even one more moment, one more second.

She pressed the palm of her hand to his stubbled cheek and nodded firmly. “I’ve never been this sure about anything, Jon.”

In literally every book Sansa had ever read, the girl had been standing on the tips of her toes right now, but Sansa didn’t need to do so. She was glad that she was wearing her flats tonight instead of the high heels Margaery had tried to make her wear.

“You look beautiful tonight.” Jon tucked a strand of strawberry blond hair behind her ear and he pressed her tighter to his chest, if that was even possible.

“Jon!” Sansa raised her voice while she closed her eyes. “Can you stop talking, please?” She licked her dry lips and pressed her forehead to his. “We’ve talked more than enough during the last few weeks. I want this. And I want this now.”

Jon curled his lips up into a smile and then his nose brushed hers.

She was not sure if he did it on purpose, if he knew how badly she wanted this, how deeply she was longing for this. For weeks she had wondered if Jon really felt the same for her as she felt for him and tonight she had not been capable of stopping herself anymore.

She had just asked him. She had just asked him if he thought about her day and night, just like she always seemed to be thinking about him these days. She had just asked him if he dreamed about her, just like all her dreams now seemed to be about him. She had just asked him if he sometimes wondered how it would be to kiss her, to touch her, to make love under a blanket of stars.

And he had said yes. His cheeks had reddened and pearls of sweat had covered his forehead. Sansa had not really understood why. She had been the one taking a risk. She had been the one taking the first step.

And now she was waiting for him to take the next one. And the longer it took, the more frustrated and excited she got.

When she felt his breath warming her waiting lips she closed her eyes and her arms circled around his neck. After what seemed to be another eternity his lips finally found hers.

They were surprisingly soft and tender and his kiss was slow and a little reluctantly.

But Sansa wanted more. Sansa needed more. And while her hands went through his dark curls, her lips parted to invite his tongue in.


Jon’s POV

Jon had kissed girls before. Most of the kisses hadn’t really meant much, apart from that one time he thought he had been in love. He was not sure what he and Ygritte had really felt for each other, but every time he looked at Sansa now he was certain it had not been love. This was love. What he felt now was love. And he was terrified that somehow he would break it.

“Are you sure you want this?” He spoke softly, dreading the moment. Somehow he was still afraid that at some point she’d discover that she could get someone much better and much smarter than him.

She pressed the palm of her hand to his stubbled cheek and nodded firmly. “I’ve never been this sure about anything, Jon.”

He wasn’t sure why he couldn’t really believe her. He wasn’t sure why there was always a voice in the back of his mind telling him that this was just a dream, that this was temporary, that somehow he’d find a way to ruin it, to break it. That somehow he wouldn’t get the girl.

“You look beautiful tonight.” Jon tucked a strand of strawberry blond hair behind her ear and he pressed her tighter to his chest because he was afraid she would slip through his fingers if he wouldn’t.

“Jon!” Sansa raised her voice while she closed her eyes. “Can you stop talking, please?” She licked her lips and pressed her warm forehead to his. “We’ve talked more than enough during the last few weeks. I want this. And I want this now.”

A strange, but pleasant warmth spread through his body. He curled his lips up into a smile and he let his nose brush hers. He didn’t know why he was so terrified of just kissing her. He didn’t know why he was hesitating. He didn’t know why he couldn’t just lean in and do it.

He had never been someone’s first choice. He had never been someone’s everything and someone’s world. And he had never dared to make someone else his first choice, his everything, his world. He knew all too well how things could change all of a sudden.

Friends could become foes within an instant. Those closest to you could eventually betray you. Trusting someone too much, could eventually lead to misery and pain.

Somehow he didn’t dare to fully believe Sansa when she had told him that she thought about him all day, that she dreamed about him at night, that she had fantasized about kissing him and loving him. He knew he didn’t have a reason to doubt her, but it was still hard to believe that someone as amazing and beautiful as her, would fall for someone like him.

Maybe he would somehow start believing it when he did kiss her and when she would kiss him back.

He leaned in and waited a few more seconds before he pressed his lips to hers. Her arms circled around his neck, but in the back of his mind Jon could still hear a voice telling him that if he’d go any further, the dream would explode and he’d wake up.

But Sansa’s hands went through his hair and the moment she parted her lips to invite his tongue in he finally realized that she meant it.

She really meant it.

And eagerly, giving into his own hunger and desire eventually, he accepted her invitation.

summary: That’s right SanSan fandom, this year there will be a Secret Santa! Starting November 1st to the 8th I will hold sign-up for...
caption:
That’s right SanSan fandom, this year there will be a Secret Santa!

Starting November 1st to the 8th I will hold sign-up for anyone wanting to join in the holiday fun! To learn more you can visit the Participation Page and our FAQ page. But the short version is this:

You come up with a 5-word prompt and send it to sansansecretsanta@yahoo.com. Then once I have all the names of everyone that wants to join, I will send out your giftee’s Tumblr name with their prompt. You will have until December 22nd to make a gift that somehow incorporates the prompt. And during that time you will also need to send your giftee Anonymous Love to help show Christmas Spirit!

If there are any other questions you might have, send me an ask here.  And make sure you follow this blog so you can get the latest updates!

summary:
Robb: what's the worse decision you made while you're drunk?
Jon: I don't mean to brag, but I don't-
Sansa: -need alcohol to...
body:
Robb: what’s the worse decision you made while you’re drunk?

Jon: I don’t mean to brag, but I don’t-

Sansa: -need alcohol to make really bad decisions? Yeah, we know.

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

summary: Queen Alysanne and her cousin King Jaehaerys
title: Queen Alysanne and her cousin King Jaehaerys
body:
According to westeros.org

In one of the earlier drafts of the Targaryen family tree, dating circa 1998, Alysanne was displayed as the daughter of King Maegor I Targaryen.

Not much later, however, George R. R. Martin changed the family tree and Alysanne became the daughter of King Aenys I Targaryen, Maegor’s older brother, instead.

As a result of this change, Alysanne’s husband, Jaehaerys I Targaryen, became her brother instead of her cousin.

I tried to find out more about this and it seems the source of this information is Elio Garcia (x) but he didn’t remember it very well and since he said his old emails are a bit of a mess he wasn’t 100% sure.

Anyway considering how much Sansa has in common with Alysanne and Jon with Jaehaerys making them also cousins seems very interesting but maybe too straightforward imho.

Maybe this is the reason why he changed this detail or maybe it’s not so important anyway this info should be taken with a grain of salt.

Currently into the MCU but still an ASOIAF and stars wars fan. Patiently waiting for TWOW as Game of Thrones is dead to me. My ships are problematic and I don't care Judy, I truly don't.

summary: Since petyr said it i think this is grrm’s plan. It’s gonna be a showdown of the queens and only one of them will survive this....
question: Since petyr said it i think this is grrm’s plan. It’s gonna be a showdown of the queens and only one of them will survive this. Maybe the survivor rules westeros. If grrm plans it to be a united land at the end at all, if not separate kingdoms. We know for sure cersie isn’t living through this lmao so its either daenerys (come full circle with a targareyn on the throne) or sansa (come full circle with petyr’s masterplan/will from the very beginning) idk im just guessing
answer:
I personally don’t think sansa will be or was one of the queens Petyr was referring to when he actually said that line. 

When he says it, in the current context of everything going on, theres Cersei, un-debated one of the queens. Margaery, also a queen, and in clear rivalry with Cersei for power and influence. Third queen is debatable. Could be Dany and that makes a lot of sense. We just don’t know how much Baelish might know about Dany or not. I’ve heard it suggested it might be Olenna ‘the Queen of thorns’.

but yeah. It’s not a prophecy, it’s not a magical statement or prediction, it’s a current anaylsis from a smart man looking at the CURRENT politics, so i think it’s current queens, so, not sansa. I could be wrong, but it’s just how I see it having been said in the way it was. I of course still believe Petyr is moving Sansa towards as much power as he can get her too.

summary: if there's an aunt sansa most resembles, wouldn't it be lysa? both are romantics who desperately want to be loved, are clever...
question: if there's an aunt sansa most resembles, wouldn't it be lysa? both are romantics who desperately want to be loved, are clever yet delusional, easily manipulated, obsessed with songs, and are not as brave as their sisters. the only difference is sansa has her mother's beauty and was never insecure like lysa was growing up. apart from their 'ladylikeness' and adherence to patriarchal norms, i don't think cat and sansa have much in common personality-wise. what do you think?
answer:
saying a character has narrative parralells or a connection or a resembles with another character doesnt mean they match up exactly on all points or are carbon copies of the other.

I also don’t think sansa and lysa have that much in common. ‘Are clever yet delusional’, firstly, Lysa never struck me as clever. She also has little social graces ,refusing to give her aid to any house, wether this could help her or not, theres no political thought farther than ‘im scared and dont want to, leave me alone’. Then even in her own sphere, showering favour on one unpopular courtier and then refusing another husband or favor to other households generally leaving everyone pissed off. like….Lysa wasn’t smart in anything she did. Sorry.

As for the delusional part, Over time Lysa had grown into a closed off, grief stricken, paranoid and obsessive mother who’d had a pretty sad life filled with little love. And again, had a lack of smarts. Baelish manipulated all of this, and again, she was so susceptible to him because of how much she’d loved him since childhood. he deluded her. she was delusional in regards to him and really went off the deep end with jealously and despair in the end. Sansa? She’s not delusional. I think she’s a teenage girl, who compartmentalises things and subconsciously twists the truth to better deal with it, and she’s wilfully ignorant to a lot of things that she doesn’t want to deal with and face. The poisoning with sweetrobin, as an example. Subconsciously she knows what’s happening, but the idea of a child dying so she can advance in her life is such a harrowing thing, she ignores it. she just needs to make sure he keeps taking sweetsleep, that’s all. The reality and consequences, she purposefully ignores. It’s not delusional, because we do see a sense of her understanding and she knows the weight of her situation, she’s not in a position to go against Baelish’s plan even if she wanted to and she’s smart enough to know that, so then it a matter of her willingly pushing the whole cruel reality of it down. Like, i’m going to put this guilt and my morals and what my parents might think of me for doing this in a box and we’re just going to shut the box and not look at it, and it’s fine, this is fine.

‘not as brave as their sisters’, don’t really want to get into it with this one, just that I think Lysa is the only one who I wouldn’t classify as brave, Cat, Sansa and Arya all have their own type and moments of bravery.

Also, Lysa is so different to sansa in most ways. she doesn’t thrive socially, men dont chase her, shes NEVER bothered to be courteous, her emotions are all over the place and run her life, and all these things are the opposite of Sansa. Like. complete opposite.

Im also not saying cat and sansa are alike in EVERYTHING, it’s just that the text MADE the links. Sansa is ladylike like her mother, pretty like her mother, the same colouring as her mother etc, and because the text deliberately makes the links, I feel like it matters more than say, similarities sansa might have with daenerys. Those similarities may exist, but they weren’t ever MADE by the book. That’s more my point. The book purposefully links sansa and cat, and arya and lyanna. I’m not saying they’re the only characters that have similarites to the girls, or that they’re exactly like these characters, ALL of these ladies are their own characters, but the books made these two links really clear.

Subconsciously she knows what’s happening, but the idea of a child dying so she can advance in her life is such a harrowing thing, she ignores it. she just needs to make sure he keeps taking sweetsleep, that’s all. The reality and consequences, she purposefully ignores. It’s not delusional, because we do see a sense of her understanding and she knows the weight of her situation, she’s not in a position to go against Baelish’s plan even if she wanted to and she’s smart enough to know that, so then it a matter of her willingly pushing the whole cruel reality of it down. Like, i’m going to put this guilt and my morals and what my parents might think of me for doing this in a box and we’re just going to shut the box and not look at it, and it’s fine, this is fine.

‘not as brave as their sisters’, don’t really want to get into it with this one, just that I think Lysa is the only one who I wouldn’t classify as brave, Cat, Sansa and Arya all have their own type and moments of bravery.

Also, Lysa is so different to sansa in most ways. she doesn’t thrive socially, men dont chase her, shes NEVER bothered to be courteous, her emotions are all over the place and run her life, and all these things are the opposite of Sansa. Like. complete opposite.

Im also not saying cat and sansa are alike in EVERYTHING, it’s just that the text MADE the links. Sansa is ladylike like her mother, pretty like her mother, the same colouring as her mother etc, and because the text deliberately makes the links, I feel like it matters more than say, similarities sansa might have with daenerys. Those similarities may exist, but they weren’t ever MADE by the book. That’s more my point. The book purposefully links sansa and cat, and arya and lyanna. I’m not saying they’re the only characters that have similarites to the girls, or that they’re exactly like these characters, ALL of these ladies are their own characters, but the books made these two links really clear.

tags: and she deserved to win it!
a song of ice and feels
summary: Sophie Turner deserved an Emmy nomination!

blog.name: alayne-stonecoldfox
blog.title: All the spice you'll need
blog.description: A 25 year old public school educated bus pass owning Libran Australian. Leo moon, Scorpio rising. I like TV, fashion, celebrities and models. Currently into the MCU but still an ASOIAF and stars wars fan. Patiently waiting for TWOW as Game of Thrones is dead to me. My ships are problematic and I don't care Judy, I truly don't.

summary: what do you think of *some people* who claim that sansa is lyanna in spirit?
question: what do you think of *some people* who claim that sansa is lyanna in spirit?
answer:
Hahaha. Yeah. The same people who can claim she’s lady alysanne in spirit, rhaenys in spirit or Naerys in spirit or or or-

Somersault bend and twist as many miniscule points as you want to fit what you want, have fun, sure, but to me Lyanna is glaringly arya ‘in spirit’, and for Sansa, she has their mother Cat as her ‘spirit’ (this term is kind of weird but we all know what we mean).

Lyanna’s name doesn’t come up one single time in Sansa’s chapters, and 4 times in arya chapters, and other characters consistently relate arya to Lyanna, which makes it a purposeful comparison from GRRM himself. GRRM also purposefully compares Sansa to Cat, something Arya does not get. Other links and parallels to lots of other characters can be made with some digging or some creativity or some damn far reaching BUT these parallels for the girls are the clearest in the actual narrative.

The only thing I can link between Sansa and lyanna myself is that they are both romantics and like songs. She has none of Lyanna’s recklessness though. Sansa has the opposite trait of recklessness, Sansa will ‘behave herself’ and go along with others, and her own strength is being able to do this and navigate her way through it safely. She is slow, watchful and cautious and all about self preservation. Whereas Arya is reckless (I don’t mean that word in a negative way, it’s an adventurous heroine trait). Lyanna also has strong associations with the north and all its traits, like Arya, whereas Sansa has traits associated with the south, like Cat.

All together i think people kind of have to IGNORE a lot of what Sansa is actually like to associate her with Lyanna, which irritates me, and then they cling to one or two points (songs and running away from a marriage) and build those up to be bigger than they are to eclipse the MORE OBVIOUS parallels to Arya.

Just one example to be summative.

“You ride like a northman, milady,” Harwin said when he’d drawn them to a halt. “Your aunt was the same. Lady Lyanna. But my father was master of horse, remember.”- Arya, ASOS

“I hate riding,” Sansa said fervently. “All it does is get you soiled and dusty and sore.”- Sansa, AGOT

tags: it may not be what you think
title: Sunday Six
body:
The interior of the room was just as simple and neat as it had seemed. The window was open, the odorous whiff of the barn at the back of the building drifting in. Voices and sounds of people going on about their business in the yard could be heard on the background, faintly.

Sandor went to the window and pulled the wooden shutters close. Enough light filtered through the woodwork for them not to sink into full darkness, but the room became shadowy.

While Sandor was attending the window, Sansa pulled the door closed and sat down on the bed.
